Here is what I am doing...I have a Datagrid whose ItemsSource is set to the DefaultView of a DataTable.  I  have a method that returns a DataRowView (again from the DefaultView of the DataTable) by searching through the Default View.  The match is found based on the Identity column in the DataTable so I'm not doing any filtering to find the DataRowView.  The method returns the DataRowView found.  I first set DataGrid.SelectedItem to the DataRowView returned.  I then call the DataGrid.ScrollIntoView(DataGrid.SelectedItem).  That is when the exception is thrown.  If I ignore the exception, the DataGrid has the correct row selected, but because of the exception, it is not visible.  You have to manually scroll to find the selected row.
 
Debugging into the WPFToolkit code.  Line 1597 in DataGrid.cs is returning a null value for FrameworkElement when it should be a DataGridRow
